Uses of Class
parallel.distributed.PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException

  • Packages that use PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException 
    Package Description
    graph.packing
    Optimization package that obtains near-optimal solution to the 1- and 2-packing combinatorial optimization problem.
    parallel.distributed
    Extends the basic functionality found in the parallel package over many remote JVMs distributed over a network of machines.

    • Uses of PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException in graph.packing

      Methods in graph.packing that throw PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void DBBTree.run() 

    • Uses of PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException in parallel.distributed

      Subclasses of PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException in parallel.distributed 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorNWAException
      indicates unavailability of capacity of all workers in a network of remote PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutor[Wrk] workers.
      Methods in parallel.distributed that throw PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt.awaitServerWorkers()
      awaits the server to which this client is connected to have at least one worker ready to execute commands.
      int PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt.getNumWorkers()
      get the current number of active workers for the server that this client is connected to.
      private void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv.PDAsynchBTEWListener.runObject(TaskObjectsAsynchExecutionRequest obj) 
      void TaskObjectsAsynchExecutionRequest.runProtocol(PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectInputStream ois, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      finds a free worker and submits the tasks for processing, then sends OKReply back to the requestor.
      void TaskObjectsAsynchParallelExecutionRequest.runProtocol(PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectInputStream ois, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      finds a free worker and submits the tasks for processing (in chunks if needed), then sends OKReply back to the (client) requestor.
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrvGetNumWrksRequest.runProtocol(PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectInputStream ois, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      unsupported operation always throws.
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorWrkAvailabilityRequest.runProtocol(PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectInputStream ois, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      unsupported operation always throws.
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorWrkQueueSizeRequest.runProtocol(PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectInputStream ois, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      unsupported operation always throws.
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrvGetNumWrksRequest.runProtocol(PDBatchTaskExecutorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectInputStream ois, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      unsupported method always throws PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException.
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorWrkAvailabilityRequest.runProtocol(PDBatchTaskExecutorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectInputStream ois, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      unsupported method always throws PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException.
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorWrkQueueSizeRequest.runProtocol(PDBatchTaskExecutorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectInputStream ois, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      unsupported method always throws PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException.
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt.sendInitCmd(PDAsynchInitCmd initcmd)
      send an init-cmd to forward to any worker connecting to the server.
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt.submitWork(java.lang.String originating_client, TaskObject[] tasks)
      sends over the network the tasks parameter to the PDBatchTaskExecutorSrv server, who then distributes them to one of the available workers in the network.
      private void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv.submitWork(TaskObjectsAsynchExecutionRequest req, PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv.PDAsynchBTEWListener t) 
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt.submitWork(java.util.Vector originating_clients, TaskObject[] tasks)
      same method as submitWork(client, tasks) but carries all the names of the hosts that have submitted the tasks to various servers (only applies when there exists more than one server in the system of servers, clients and workers).
      (package private) void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv.submitWork(java.util.Vector originating_clients, TaskObject[] tasks)
      searches (up to _NUM_ATTEMPTS times) among all its worker connections, to find a connection to the worker with the most free threads.
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt.submitWorkFromSameHost(TaskObject[] tasks)
      the main method of the class.
      void PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt.submitWorkFromSameHostInParallel(TaskObject[] tasks, int max_chunk_size)
      the second main method of the class, works as the method submitWorkFromSameHost(), except that it breaks the tasks into chunks of the given size, and submits them one at a time.
